"Information Expansion" Chinese Encoding Character Set
1 This document specifies the hexadecimal representation of Chinese graphic characters and binary codes for information technology.
This document is applicable to the processing, exchange, storage, transmission, display, input and output of Chinese and other character information.

This document is applicable to technical products with Chinese and other character information processing and exchange functions, including but not limited to software products represented by input methods, optical character recognition (OCR), editing and proofreading, machine translation, voice synthesis, text transcription, and so on, as well as handy products represented by computers, communication terminals, e-book readers, and learning machines.
2. Reference documents with a tendency to leak
the content of the following documents is incorporated by reference into this document as a necessary clause by the normative reference in the text.

Among them, the quoted documents with the date are only applicable to the version corresponding to the date; the quoted documents without the date are applicable to the latest version (including all the modification documents) of the document.
GB/T 2312-1980 “Code for the Character Set for Information Exchange Using Chinese Characters” Basic Set

3 Terms and Definitions
The following terms and definitions apply to this document.
3.1 character
one of the elements in a set of elements used to represent, control, or organize data.
3.2 Coded character
character (3.1) and its encoding are shown.
3.3 Private use area defined by user
the area that the user of the product that conforms to this document can freely define.
3.4 Vocabulary repertoire
a specified set of characters (3.1) represented by a set of encoded characters (3.2).
3.5 reserved zone
shall be reserved for future use in accordance with the provisions of this document.
4 vocabulary
4.1 Overview
The characters in this document are encoded as single-byte, double-byte, or four-byte characters.
The single-byte part includes all 128 characters from 0x00 to 0x7F in GB/T 11383-1989.
4.3 Double-byte Part
The double-byte part includes all the graphic characters in GB/T 2312-1980, all the CJK unified ideographs in GB/T 13000, and some graphic characters.
the characters of the two-byte part shall be in accordance with the provisions of Appendix A.
Among them, the graphic, code location and function of the ideographic character descriptor shall comply with the provisions of Appendix B.
Note: GB/T 13000 is a unified encoding for Chinese characters used in China, Japan, Korea, Vietnam, etc.

The Chinese characters with unique abstract forms are assigned with individual code positions, and the Chinese characters with the same abstract forms but different sources are assigned with shared code positions.
The Chinese characters encoded are called CJK Unified Ideographs, where CJK stands for China, Japan, and Korea.
4.4 Four-byte Part

The four-byte part includes 66 CJK unified ideographs (9FA6-9FEF, excluding 9FB4-9FBB) in GB/T 13000, CJK unified ideograph extension A, CJK unified ideograph extension B, CJK unified ideograph extension C, CJK unified ideograph extension D, CJK unified ideograph extension E, and characters of minority ethnic group scripts that have been encoded in GB/T 13000.
the characters in the four-byte portion shall be in accordance with the provisions of Appendix C.
5 Overall structure
Any number preceded by 0x in the main text means hexadecimal, and any number without 0x means decimal.
all encoded representations in the appendix are in hexadecimal, and all other numbers are in decimal.
The single-byte part adopts the encoding structure of GB/T 11383-1989 and uses the 0x00~0x7F code bits.

The double-byte character set uses two 8-bit binary bit strings to represent a character, and the first byte code bit is from 0x81 to 0xFE, and the last byte code bit is from 0x40 to 0x7E and 0x80 to 0xFE.
The four-byte part uses 0x30-0x39, which are not adopted in GB/ISO 11383-1989, as the suffix for the extension of the double-byte encoding. The encoding range is 0x81308130-0xFE39FE39.

The first character of the four-byte character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the second character is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39; the third character is encoded in the range of 0x81 to 0xFE; the fourth character is encoded in the range of 0x30 to 0x39. That is, 0x81308130 to 0x81308139; 0

6.3 The arrangement order of the characters in the four-character brushing part

From 0x81308130 to 0x8439FE39, a total of 50400 code positions, corresponding to all characters of the GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane that are not included in the double-byte part, are arranged in the order of the corresponding characters of the GB/T 13000 basic multilingual plane.

From 0x90308130 to 0xE339FE39, a total of 1058400 bits are used to correspond to the 16 auxiliary planes of GB/T 13000, and the character arrangement order is completely in accordance with the order of the corresponding bits of the 16 auxiliary planes of GB/T 13000.
the order of the characters in the four-byte part shall comply with Appendix C.

8. Explanation of some characters and codes
Compared with GB 18030-2005, the characters and/or the corresponding GB/TI 13000 codes in some code positions have been adjusted in this document (see Appendix D).
9.1 General Provisions
this document defines three levels of implementation.
The system software product that meets the corresponding realization level shall provide the input and output function of all characters in the corresponding realization level range.
9.2 Achieve Level 1

achieve the CJK unified ideographs (i.e., 0x82358F33-0x82359636) and CJK unified ideographs extension A (i.e., 0x8139EE39-0x82358738) of the single byte encoding part, the double season encoding part, and the four-character down encoding part of the level 1 document file.
any product to which this document applies shall meet the requirements of level 1.
Note: according to the needs of software application, level 1 can also choose any one or more non-Han scripts listed in the column 3 of the document holder.
9.3 Achieve Level 2
level 2 includes level 1.
In addition, the level 2 realization also includes the characters that are not included in the level 1 realization but are included in the "General Standard Chinese Characters Table".
The code positions and forms of the characters in the (General Standard Chinese Characters Table) are shown in the appendix.
system software and supporting software shall meet the requirements of level 2.

Note: the system software and the text support software include but are not limited to the operating system, the database management system, and the middleware (see the information of software product classification in GB/T 36475).
9.4 Achieve Level 3
Level 3 includes Level 2.
In addition, the level 3 realization should include all the Chinese characters stipulated in the original document and the KangXi radicals in Table 3.
products for government and public services should meet the requirements of level 3.

Note: the public service and common service industries include but are not limited to railway transportation, road transportation, water transportation, air transportation, multimodal transportation and transportation agency, postal and telecommunications, currency and financial services, insurance, land management, health, national institutions, social security, etc. (information on industry classification is available in GB/T 4754).

executive summary
The impact of COVID-19 on the drug market
Its impact may be similar to the 2008 economic crisis
The global COVID-19 pandemic has plunged the world into an unprecedented crisis.

in many countries , the disease has overwhelmed health care systems , bringing them close to collapse , and the restrictions imposed by governments have caused severe disruptions to the global economy .
The impact of this pandemic on the drug market is unclear and difficult to predict, but it could be far-reaching.
Some producers may be forced to seek new ways to make drugs because the restrictions on movement also restrict access to precursors and basic chemicals.
Smugglers may have to find new routes and methods as they are unable to cross borders due to travel restrictions.
patterns of drug use and provision may change , and the government 's ability to respond may be hampered .
The changes brought by the COVID-19 pandemic are unprecedented, but we can still learn some lessons from previous crises.
After the 2008 economic crisis, some drug addicts began to seek cheaper synthetic substances, and their drug use patterns shifted to injection.
At the same time, governments around the world have cut budgets related to drugs.
interventions and treatment services for drug use and related risky behaviors may be severely affected if governments respond to the current economic downturn in the same way.
In addition, the priority of interception actions and international cooperation may be reduced, making it easier for traffickers to operate.
Some countries have a large amount of drugs smuggled through commercial flights, and it is estimated that these countries will be most directly affected by the drug trafficking activities.

Methamphetamine and other synthetic drugs are sometimes carried in a carry-on bag or hidden in personal luggage, and sometimes in large quantities. Since almost all countries have implemented restrictions on air passenger transportation, the supply of drugs by commercial aviation may be completely interrupted.
Although the international postal supply chain has also been disrupted, the activities of trafficking using the dark web and parcel post may increase.
In the long run, economic downturns and related lockdown measures may disrupt the drug market.

As unemployment rises and opportunities dwindle, the poor and disadvantaged are more likely to turn to drugs in harmful ways, to become addicted to them, and to turn to illegal activities related to drugs, whether production or transportation.
Drug trafficking organizations may take advantage of this situation to provide services to vulnerable populations and recruit new members to bolster their ranks.
As the government's capacity to respond declines, these changes may quickly take root and become a new reality for many communities.
expansion and complexity
Market growth
The pattern of population growth partly explains the expansion of the market
drug use has been increasing worldwide, both in terms of the total number of users and the proportion of the world's population that is addicted to drugs.

In 2009, it was estimated that there were 210 million drug users, accounting for 4.8% of the global population aged 15-64, while in 2018, it was estimated that there were 269 million drug users, accounting for 5.3% of this population.
in the past two decades, the growth rate of drug abuse in developing countries has far exceeded that of developed countries.

This to some extent reflects the difference in overall population growth during this period, with 7% in developed countries and 28% in developing countries, but also reflects the fact that the population of young people in developing countries grows faster.
The proportion of young people and young adults in drug addicts is the largest.
Between 2000 and 2018, the population in this age group in developing countries increased by 16%, while in developed countries it decreased by 10%.
1 urbanization is a driving force in the current and future drug market
Whether in developed countries or developing countries, the drug abuse in urban areas is more serious than that in rural areas.

The overall increase in drug use is partly due to the large-scale movement of people from rural to urban areas - currently more than half the world's population lives in urban areas, compared to 34% in 1960.
Urbanization is likely to be a key factor in the future dynamics of the drug market, particularly in developing countries where urbanization trends are more pronounced.

increases in wealth are associated with increases in drug use , but the burden of disease is greatest among the poorest people in the world . drug use is more prevalent in developed countries than in developing countries .
Drugs such as cocaine are more firmly linked to the world's wealthier regions.
Similarly, within each country, the prevalence of drug use is higher among the more affluent social classes.
However, the proportion of people who switched to drug addiction was higher among those with lower socioeconomic status.
data from a few countries suggest that harmful drug @-@ use patterns and disorders are linked to low income .
These patterns are less common in more affluent social classes.
The economic constraints caused by the global Covid-19 crisis are likely to exacerbate the risks faced by the most vulnerable groups, including drug users.

For example, changes in the labor market, such as rising unemployment, have historically been associated with increases in drug use, and this pandemic has forced millions of people around the world out of work.

COVID-19 may lead to further expansion of the drug market The COVID-19 pandemic may lead to more farmers increasing or engaging in illegal crop cultivation, or because the control ability of the national authorities is reduced, or because more people may be forced to take risks and engage in illegal activities under the economic crisis.

The related restrictions on the COVID-19 pandemic have led to a reduction in air and land transportation, and the maritime smuggling may have increased as a result. The risk of interception at sea is low, and the amount of smuggling by sea is more than that by air or land.
There have been reports that cocaine shipments are being transported directly from South America to Europe by sea.
complexity enhancement
The situation of non-controlled substances is stable, but the number of new types of opioids with potential harm is increasing, and the drug market is becoming more and more complicated.
In addition to cannabis, cocaine and heroin, hundreds of synthetic drugs have been added to the list, many of which are not controlled internationally. Non-medical use of drugs is also on the rise.
There are about 500 new active substances in the domestic market of member countries every year.
At present, most of them are stimulants, followed by synthetic cannabinoid receptor agonists and a small amount of opioids.
Although the total number of new psychoactive substances has been stabilized, the proportion has changed.
In the total number of new psychoactive substances confirmed in 2014, the proportion of new psychoactive substances of the opium type was only 2%, but by 2018, this proportion had risen to 9%.

many of the new psychoactive substances in the class of opioids are analogs of fentanyl , and their pharmacologic effects and harms have been documented , leading to overdose deaths in North America and elsewhere , although to a lesser extent .
In North America , fentanyl is sometimes used as an adulterant in heroin and other drugs , including cocaine and methamphetamine , and sometimes used to make counterfeit pharmaceutical opioids .

some evidence suggests that the phenomenon of injecting new psychostimulants is also prevalent in Europe: a study of the remnants of discarded syringes in six European cities found that many of the syringes were contaminated with new psychostimulants that produce stimulant effects.
2. The use of new psychoactive substances may become firmly entrenched in vulnerable groups
single new psychoactive substances have rarely formed large markets.
But evidence from Europe suggests that synthetic cannabinoids are a serious problem among socially marginalized groups such as the homeless and prisoners.
22 countries reported the use of new psychoactive substances in prisons , with most countries identifying synthetic cannabinoids as the main challenge .

the control of precursor chemicals forces drug makers to innovate. Many chemicals that are commonly used as precursors to synthesize methamphetamine, methylenedioxyamphetamine (MDA), and "ecstasy" have been placed under international control.
Drug dealers and chemists have been looking for alternatives - not just substances that are less tightly controlled, but chemicals designed to circumvent controls, known as "precursor chemicals."
restrictive measures to prevent the spread of Covid-19 are likely to further squeeze the drug makers who rely on precursor chemicals.

evidence from Mexico suggests that this is already a reality : reports indicate that a shortage of methamphetamine precursors imported from East Asia in March 2020 led to increases in methamphetamine prices in Mexico and the United States .
the market is always changing
Synthetic drugs replace opiates in Central Asia and the Russian Federation
the market for opioids in Central Asia and the Russian Federation appears to have changed between 2008 and 2018 .
The number of people being treated for opioid use has fallen sharply, while the amount of opioids seized by Russian authorities has dropped by about 80%.
But the stimulant market seems to be booming.
there is evidence that methamphetamine and various cathinones , including methoxymethamphetamine and a @-@ pyrrolidinylpentedrone , are now readily available on the Russian drug market .

The Russian authorities reported that the number of secret production sites for illegal drugs has increased sharply in recent years. In the past two years, the number of production sites has doubled to 152 in 2018.
Methamphetamine market in Afghanistan and Iraq grows
as early as 2012 , surveys of personnel in hospitals , prisons , and other institutions had revealed the importance of methamphetamine in Iraq .
Crystal meth has become another major drug of concern, along with fentanyl and tramadol.
A 2015 study further confirmed these findings, with users saying that marijuana was harder to get than "OxyContin" or methamphetamine.

Recently, the Iraqi authorities have discovered several methamphetamine processing sites, and the Drug Enforcement Administration has expressed concern about the large-scale importation of pseudoephedrine-based products that are used as precursors by methamphetamine processing sites.
Methamphetamine production in Afghanistan appears to have started in 2014.
Since then, the amount of methamphetamine seized has been steadily rising.
But the amount of ivory seized in the first half of 2019 was 6.57 tons, a sharp increase compared with the previous year.
The large amount of methamphetamine seized in other countries is also evidence that the production is rapidly increasing.
Policy changes and trends
The jurisdictions that have legalized the non-medical use of cannabis have a tendency to see an increase in cannabis use
Eleven jurisdictions in Canada, Uruguay and the United States allow the production of cannabis products for non-medical use.
in most of these jurisdictions , cannabis use has increased since legalization , although similar trends have been observed in jurisdictions that have not legalized nonmedical cannabis use .

In the two states in the United States that first passed legislation, Colorado and Washington, the number of adults who use marijuana for non-medical purposes has increased, especially in the past month and daily or almost daily use, which has exceeded the national average since 2012.
All indicators show that marijuana use in Uruguay has increased since 2011, with use nearly doubling last month.
This suggests that the increase is mainly due to frequent and regular use of cannabis.
Short-term data from Canada also shows that as the legal market expanded from 2018 to 2019, so did use.
However, 40% of cannabis users still get some products from illegal sources in 2019.
The reason for the sharp decline in the global seizure of cannabis is the legalization of cannabis?
In 2018, the global seizure of cannabis plants fell to the lowest level in 20 years, due to a drop in North America, which fell by 84% in the past decade.

By contrast, seizures in other parts of the world nearly doubled during the same period. The pattern of seizures suggests that policies aimed at liberalizing the market played a key role in the decline.

the regulation of new psychoactive substances appears to have a suppressive effect on the domestic regulation of new psychoactive substances , and it is still difficult to assess the effectiveness of the regulation of new psychoactive substances .
countries with different regulatory systems for new psychoactive substances have shown different prevalence rates of use of these substances .
in other countries , use of novel psychoactive substances has decreased after domestic legislation .
the use of opioids for pain management and palliative care is mainly provided in high @-@ income countries , and the distribution of these drugs is uneven across regions .
In 2018, more than 90% of all the drugs used for medical consumption were in high-income countries.
About 50% are in North America, 40% in Europe, and 2% in Oceania.
These countries account for about 12% of the world’s population.
It is estimated that the population of low- and middle-income countries accounts for 88% of the world's population, but the consumption of opium for medicinal purposes accounts for less than 10%.
obstacles to obtaining opioid medications are related to many factors , including legislation , culture , health care systems , and prescribing practices .
People who are poorer are more likely to have a substance use disorder. In 2018, an estimated 3.56 million people had a substance use disorder.

poverty , limited education , and social marginalization may increase the risk of substance use disorders and exacerbate their consequences . this has been demonstrated in high @-@ income countries , where adverse socioeconomic trajectories -- not just a person 's circumstances at a given point in time -- are associated with the risk of substance use disorders .

drug use disorders also deepen social and economic disadvantage , further increasing the risk of unemployment , poverty , and homelessness , thereby perpetuating a vicious cycle of disadvantage . These outcomes may also be related to the stigmatizing attitudes and consequences within the criminal justice system .

women , members of minority groups , immigrants , members of sexual and gender minority groups , people displaced by armed conflict or disaster , and people in rural settings may be disproportionately affected by substance use disorders or have difficulty accessing treatment services .

according to the disability @-@ adjusted life @-@ year ( DALY ) metric , which estimates the number of healthy life @-@ years lost because of disability and premature death , the harmful effects of drug use have increased in the past decade and have a broader societal impact .
between 2007 and 2018 , the global years of life lost attributable to drug use increased by 17 % .
the increase in years of life lost to liver cancer attributable to untreated hepatitis C among injection drug users was particularly high , at 40 % .
the relationship between drugs and violence is complex and difficult to determine all the causal relationships between the use of psychoactive substances and violence .
limited data from around the world suggest that intoxication may be an important factor in homicide .
But in violent incidents, alcohol seems to have a greater effect than drugs.

although drug use may lead to crime , in some cases this association can be partly attributed to multiple intervening factors , such as socioeconomic disadvantage and other types of adversity that are caused by individual risk , family environment , and peer influences .
The link between drug trafficking and violence is multifaceted.
If there is a stable criminal structure, including large-scale organized crime activities such as international drug trafficking, it is possible to carry out these activities without violence.

In the short term, the presence and extent of violence are more a function of changes in the balance of power among organized crime groups than of the amount of trafficking. These changes include fluctuations in the size of the illegal market, the death or incarceration of prominent criminals, and law enforcement actions that weaken one group relative to another.
the latest trend
Drug abuse of marijuana is the most common substance, and the harm of opioids is the most serious
An estimated 192 million people used cannabis in 2018, making it the most widely used drug in the world.
By comparison, 58 million people used opioids in 2018.
However, the related harms of opioids are ignored because of the small number of users.

of the estimated 167,000 deaths in 2017 attributable to drug use disorders , 66 % were caused by these substances , and 50 % of the 21 million years of life lost to disability or premature death from drug use were attributable to these substances .
Nonmedical use of synthetic opioids exacerbates public health crisis

In West, Central and North Africa, the crisis is driven by tramadol; in North America, it is fentanyl. These two regions have little in common in terms of economics, demographics or general patterns of drug use, but they are both struggling with a crisis fueled by a substance that is readily available and cheap to produce.
in North America , the use of synthetic opioids such as fentanyl has led to a 20 @-@ year increase in the number of opioid @-@ related deaths .
of the 67,367 excess deaths registered in the United States in 2018 , two thirds involved fentanyl .
Canada also reported similar results, albeit at lower numbers.
part of the reason for the excess deaths from fentanyl is the unpredictable potency of fentanyl in the illicit drug market .
the market for nonmedical use of ketamine has grown substantially in West Africa , Central Africa , and North Africa .
In this area, the number of patients with conditions treated with tramadol is increasing.
In 2017, the global amount of captured curmarodone increased significantly, reaching a peak of more than 125 tons.
But in 2018, after India passed a new law regulating curcumin, global seizures dropped to 32 tons.

The two factors that have contributed to the crisis are the ease of manufacture and low production costs, as well as the lack of international regulation of curamadol and many of its analogues and precursors.
The two crises are exacerbated by the fact that these substances are available in both the legal and illegal drug markets, making them harder to detect and prevent from being abused.
The use of stimulants is increasing
The stimulant market is dominated by cocaine and methamphetamine, and both substances are on the rise in their primary markets.
In 2018, about 19 million people used cocaine, because it is popular in North America and Western Europe.
About 27 million people used amphetamines that year, with methamphetamine being the most commonly used amphetamine-type stimulant in Southeast Asia and North America.
According to most indicators, the use of methamphetamine in these two regions has been expanding for the past 20 years.

In some markets, cocaine and methamphetamine can coexist, sometimes as substitutes, so that the use of one drug rises as the use of the other falls, and sometimes both rise and fall to meet the demand of the same market.
COVID-19 increases risk for injection drug users
It is estimated that there were about 11.3 million people who injected drugs in 2018, and about 10% of the world's HIV infections were caused by drug injection.
More than 10 million people infected with HIV and 5.5 million people infected with hepatitis C virus are injection drug users.
In 2017, about 585,000 people died from drug overdose, of which half died from liver disease caused by hepatitis C, and most of the hepatitis C among injecting drug users remained untreated.

the shortages of opioids caused by COVID @-@ 19 restrictions may lead to the substitution of more readily available substances such as alcohol or benzodiazepines or the combination of opioids with synthetic drugs .
as some users switch to injection or more frequent injection , there may be more harmful use patterns .

EU summit debates refugee policy, EU officials: bottlenecks at every step of the process - chinanews.com
EU summit wrangles over refugee policy, EU official: bottlenecks at every step of reception process

[Global Times reporter in Belgium, Niurui Fei] According to the report of Agence France-Presse on February 10, at the latest EU summit on the same day, the president of the European Commission, Ursula von der Leyen, said that the EU leaders agreed to adopt stricter policies on illegal immigrants to facilitate the deportation of illegal immigrants.
The move is a response to the growing problem of illegal immigration in Europe, where the core issue is that very few illegal immigrants are eventually deported.

According to the summit document, the EU leaders called on the Commission to "immediately mobilize a large amount of EU funds" to strengthen the external border by means of infrastructure and surveillance.
However, the EU and its member states have been arguing over the payment of the fence fees.
Barnier has repeatedly said that the EU funds will not pay for the related expenses.

But some foreign ministers of member states said that if the EU can bear part of the cost of installing cameras, watchtowers and other basic facilities along the external borders, it will free up national budgets and speed up the construction process.

The European Euractiv website said that the EU officials admitted that there were bottlenecks in every step of the refugee reception process. The limited reception capacity and the overwhelmed immigration authorities of the member states could not stop the refugees from submitting "countless" asylum applications in the EU countries. The EU's refugee reception system was in a near "permanent crisis".

According to the estimate of the European Commission, the Schengen countries of the European Union received more than 920,000 asylum applications last year, an increase of nearly 50% from the previous year.
At the same time, the EU recorded more than 333,000 illegal border crossings last year.

Against this background, the summit also reached an agreement on a "principle" that EU countries can deport illegal immigrants to their home countries based on the court judgments of another member country.
In addition, the report said that the EU leaders also agreed to "increase the use of the concept of safe countries", which would pave the way for the EU to formulate a common list.
(Source: Global Times, Author: Niurui Fei)
US Upgrades “Chip War”, Devastating Global Semiconductor Industry - chinanews.com

Recently, the US has escalated its “chip war” against China. Then, according to foreign media reports, the US government is considering cutting off all links between US suppliers and Huawei, prohibiting US suppliers from providing any products to Huawei; the Biden administration is also preparing to issue an executive order to limit US investment in sensitive Chinese technology industries... In the early days

In recent years, the United States has never stopped its actions to suppress China's "core" development. On the one hand, it has precisely suppressed the supply chain of China's semiconductor production, and on the other hand, it has built a semiconductor industry chain alliance to "go Chinese", in order to completely "get rid of" China in the advanced semiconductor industry.

Whether it is to establish a "technical alliance" with South Korea or to establish a "four-party alliance" of chips with South Korea, Japan and Taiwan, or to establish a "small circle" of semiconductor industry chain by means of the "four-edge mechanism" and "Indo-Pacific economic framework" of the United States, Japan, India and Australia, the United States attempts to build a closed production and supply chain cycle dominated by the United States by introducing the means of politic
However, the US’s large-scale “chip war” against China is also “killing one thousand and injuring eight hundred”.

Recently, the US well-known chip manufacturing equipment supplier Applied Materials announced that it would dismiss 1,300 full-time employees and plan to dismiss 1,400 temporary employees in the next two quarters due to the latest round of export ban on chip manufacturing equipment to China.
Recently, ASML Holding, a global leader in photolithography, warned that the ban on exporting semiconductor manufacturing equipment to China may lead to an increase in semiconductor prices.

According to the analysis of the US media, after the US government implemented the brutal suppression on the Chinese chip and semiconductor industries, many US companies suffered greatly, including the developers of electronic design automation tools, chip designers, manufacturers of wafer manufacturing equipment, and chip manufacturers themselves.
The US’s so-called suppression of China’s advanced semiconductor industry has dragged the global semiconductor industry chain and supply chain down.
The semiconductor industry is a high-tech and knowledge-intensive industry, and has long formed a closely linked global semiconductor industry chain.
According to professional estimates, the entire production process of semiconductor products needs to cross the national border more than 70 times, and the whole process takes 100 days.
Although the US semiconductor industry has a strong foundation, it is relatively weak in manufacturing capabilities, especially in advanced process technology, and is heavily dependent on East Asia.

Even if the United States tries to guide the advanced chip supply chain to the "small circle" regional development dominated by the United States, it is difficult to change the regional distribution and interdependence of the global semiconductor industry.
The US’s powerful “restructuring” and “de-Chinization” of the semiconductor industry chain has dealt a heavy blow to the global semiconductor industry.
The chip is the core of the future industry in the world, and the development of the chip industry cannot be separated from the joint participation of all countries in the world.

In recent years, the United States has taken a series of unilateral actions, successively enacted the Innovation and Competition Act, the 2022 United States Competition Act, and the Chip and Science Act, and used its technological hegemony to consolidate its technological leading position; it has used both carrot and stick to coerce Intel, TSMC, Samsung, and other chip manufacturing enterprises to set up factories in the United States, and has made every effort to ensure that the United States
In the short term, the US has indeed caused trouble for China's semiconductor industry and related industries, and reaped real benefits.

However, in the long run, the US’s hysterical suppression will force China’s chip industry to make breakthroughs continuously, and it will lose the huge Chinese market. Ultimately, it will greatly weaken the innovation will and innovation ability of US technology enterprises, and damage the development of the global chip industry.

First batch of personal pension fund financial products go on sale. Shortest holding period is 360 days - chinanews.com
First batch of personal pension fund financial products go on sale
Seven products from home institutions are available for selection. The shortest holding period is 360 days.
The personal pension fund financial products have finally been launched.

On February 10, chinacn.com released the first batch of personal pension fund financial products list. The seven personal pension fund financial products of Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, Agricultural Bank of China and China Post Financial Services officially went on sale.

At this point, the "shelf" of the individual pension account has finally gathered four types of products, including individual pension savings, individual pension financial management, individual pension insurance, and individual pension public fund.

It is reported that the first batch of individual pension fund financial products are all public offering net value open-end products. Among them, there are 5 newly issued products and 2 continuing products. Except for one mixed product, the rest 6 products are all fixed-income products.

The Beijing Youth Daily reporter saw that out of the five newly launched products, four came from Industrial and Commercial Bank of China Wealth Management, and all were fixed-income products. The shortest holding period was 365 days, 540 days, 720 days, and 1080 days, and the corresponding performance comparison benchmarks (annualized) were 3.70% - 4.20%, 4.10% - 4.60%, 4.40% - 4

The remaining new product is "Bank and Post Wealth Add Yitian Hongjin Shortest Holding 1095 Days No. 1", which is also a fixed-income product. It started to collect funds on February 10 and ended on February 19. The risk level is level 2.

Among the two surviving products, one is the Agricultural Bank of China Wealth Management "Agricultural Bank of China Unity and Agility" 360-day technology innovation RMB wealth management product, which is of mixed investment nature and has a risk level of three.

Another surviving product is "Bank and Post Wealth Add Yin Hongjing Shortest Holding 365 Days 1 Number", a fixed-income type, which began to collect in December 30, 2017 and officially operated on January 4, 2018. The accumulated net value on February 8 was 1.0011.

According to the "Opinions of the General Office of the State Council on Promoting the Development of Personal Pension", the financial products that can be invested by the pension fund account of the personal pension fund include bank wealth management, savings deposit, commercial pension insurance, public fund, etc.

The first batch of personal pension fund investment products were sold, which means that investors of personal pension fund can officially purchase investment products through the personal pension fund capital account.

The China Banking and Insurance Regulatory Commission issued the "Interim Measures for the Management of Individual Retirement Savings Business of Commercial Banks and Financial Institutions" in November last year.

The Regulation stipulates that participants can purchase personal pension savings, personal pension fund management products, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public offering fund products, etc. of personal pension products through their personal pension fund accounts.

Then, the Ministry of Human Resources and Social Security, the Ministry of Finance and the State Administration of Taxation issued a notice to clarify that the individual pension system will be implemented in 36 pilot cities and regions, including Beijing, Tianjin, Shijiazhuang in Hebei Province, Xiong’an New Area, Jinzhong City in Shanxi Province, and so on.
As of the end of 2022, the number of participants in the individual pension plan was 19.54 million, the number of contributors was 6.13 million, and the total contribution amount was RMB14.2 billion.

Previously, the banks participating in the pilot program only listed three types of products: personal pension savings, personal pension insurance products, and personal pension public offering funds.
Now that the personal pension fund financial products have been gathered, how should investors choose?

The expert of the Research and Development Department of the China Construction Bank Wealth Management said that compared with other personal pension products, the pension wealth management products and the personal pension wealth management products in the pilot phase have three characteristics.
First, stability. The risk management mechanism is more complete, investment strategies and concepts are more stable, and non-affiliated third-party independent custody is implemented.

The second is the long-term nature. The term of the pension financial products in the pilot phase is 5 years or more. The next pension financial products issued to individuals will have a minimum holding period of 1 year, and it is encouraged to hold them for 3 years or more.

The third is the inclusiveness. The threshold of product purchase is low, and the starting point is generally 1 yuan, and some are as low as 0.01 yuan. The rates of product custody fees, management fees, and other fees are more favorable.
Professional people pointed out that investors should choose according to the characteristics of the product and their own risk tolerance.

The personal pension savings has the characteristics of long-term period, high interest rate and high safety, which is suitable for people with weak risk tolerance; the personal pension insurance product is mainly for guarantee, which is more suitable for people who cannot bear investment risk and can accept stable income; while the personal pension financial product and the public fund product do not guarantee the capital and the return, but have certain investment risk, and the expected return is high, which is suitable for people with certain financial knowledge and high

The fitness industry should get rid of the trust crisis-China News Network
Another large gym goes bankrupt?
Recently, the issue of the rights of members of the well-known fitness institution Zhongjian Fitness has attracted social attention.

After the Spring Festival, many members found that their stores were not operating normally. Then, rumors about the collapse of the institution and the escape of the money caused panic among the members, which led to the intervention of the public security and human resources departments.

Finally, the relevant person in charge of the institution responded and promised to make every effort to protect the legitimate rights and interests of the employees and members, and the storm subsided.

Some branches of some fitness institutions have encountered problems in operation and are temporarily closed. Consumers can wait calmly for the problem to be solved. Why did many members’ first reaction to this be “something is wrong”?
Behind the controversy of the rights of members of fitness clubs, there are deep-seated problems of the industry’s trust crisis.
Traditional domestic gyms generally adopt the prepayment model, and “making money from customers who don’t come” is the bottom line of their development.
By getting cash flow through pre-sale membership cards and opening new stores, it seems to be a cyclical process, but in fact it is eating the seed corn, and cannot form a stable profit model.
The negative information about the gym and other industries frequently reported has caused a strong impact on the consumer confidence.
From the market perspective, gyms are certainly a good business with a bright future.
Although the fitness race track has ups and downs, it has always been a focus of capital attention.
Multiple data show that the popularity of cultural and entertainment consumption is on the rise, and the market is continuing to warm up.
As for the fitness market, with the steady improvement of residents’ living standards and the deepening of the concept of healthy life, the fitness industry has great potential for development.
The better the situation is, the more the industry needs to pay attention to the development quality.

However, some institutions are blindly optimistic about the fitness market after the consumption recovery. They just got out of the crisis and sounded the trumpet of expansion. They put all the financing funds into the construction of new stores.

It is undeniable that in the past few years, many institutions have withdrawn from the market due to the impact of the epidemic, and the industry has been reorganized. At this time, enterprises with strong capabilities choose to increase their acquisition efforts and reorganize their layout selectively, which may be a new opportunity.
However, in order to enter a virtuous circle and achieve sustainable development, the industry must change its traditional mode and change its business strategy.
Only by making steady progress and re-establishing the trust and security of consumers can we truly win the market and the future.
Compared with building new stores to occupy the market, the fitness industry currently needs to focus on optimizing services and stabilizing users with high-quality development.
First, we need to retain users by providing services.

Gym belongs to the service industry. Its essence is to adhere to "user-oriented". It should closely focus on the needs of users and put the focus of operation on improving and upgrading the quality of service.
Secondly, we should improve user experience by digital transformation.
For example, the current popular internet gym model allows users to pay per session and choose their own venue.
At the same time, the body data and the sports data can be effectively utilized, and the social needs can be satisfied, realizing the complete service closed loop from online to offline.
Without private trainers to push sales and without huge annual membership cards, users’ worries about fitness institutions “running away” are reduced, and their trust is increased.
In addition, we should actively explore diversified business models.

Nowadays, sports consumption has moved from single service to scene consumption. Fitness clubs are expected to become a new consumption entrance. The peripheral products such as sports nutrition and fitness equipment required for fitness may become new profit points, providing consumers with more choices.

buy expensive and get refund!
Nanjing real estate market sees "price difference compensation" again - chinanews.com

Yangtze Evening News (Reporter Ma Zuo Bo) Yangtze Evening News/Zinu News Reporter found on the 10th that after more than ten years, the "price guarantee agreement" has returned to the Nanjing real estate market. A residential complex in the Jiangbei New District claims to "compensate the difference in price" and offers more benefits than the previous discount for other properties before the delivery. The developer is willing to exchange the property and refund
The "price guarantee" conditions are not few
The property is called Poly International Yangzi Cui Yun Tuan, and Mr. Sun, the viewer, told the reporter that he found a "notice" when he was browsing the property last weekend.

The developer of the project promised in the pictures sent to the reporters that if the buyers purchased the property between February 1 and February 28, the developer would exchange the property and refund the difference if the other properties in the project had a greater discount than the discount the buyers had previously enjoyed (limited to other unsold properties of the same type, same building, same unit, and same property type as the property).

Mr. Sun said that the property consultant said that this was actually a "price guarantee agreement", which was intended to make the buyer feel at ease to sell, without worrying about the developer lowering the price to promote sales, "Now I'm afraid that it will be lowered after I buy it, and I don't have time to go to the sales office to make a fuss. If I don't make a fuss, I will really feel bad."
However, some buyers believe that the "price guarantee agreement" is a "pill to calm the nerves" for buyers, but the conditions are not low.

Ms. Zheng, who plans to buy a home for her family in Jiangbei, said that the properties with price guarantee must be of the same type, in the same building, and in the same unit. There are few properties that buyers can compare prices with, so the "barrier" is still quite high.

Some buyers believe that due to the asymmetry of information, the sellers may not exclude the possibility of giving additional concessions during the sales, and it is not easy for the buyers to "defend their rights".
Whether the buyers can be retained remains to be seen

The reporter learned from the Nanjing Online Real Estate that the sales permit of the two buildings in the project was issued in November last year, with a total of 252 units, including 105 square meters, 114 square meters, and 129 square meters, and the average price of the fully decorated sales permit was 39843 yuan per square meter.

However, two months later, the online real estate shows that the total number of unsold units in the project is 157, accounting for 62.3%. Among them, there are 128 units in Building 8, and 113 units are unsold. There are 44 unsold units in Building 7, and the total number of units sold is only 33, accounting for 13%.
Market sources said that the "price guarantee agreement" had also appeared in Nanjing in 2008.

In August of that year, the residential building Hushitangxiyuan on Huangshan Road in Hexi District launched the "Price Guarantee Plan" to attract buyers. The specific content was "the company solemnly promised that if the project's discount increased within one year, the company would refund the difference to the old owners."
In April 2011, 9 residential buildings in Nanjing also promised to compensate the difference in price.
“The real estate market is warming up, and it needs a “heart stimulant” at this time.
"Mr. Shen, a senior operator in the real estate industry in Nanjing, said that the "price guarantee agreement" is also one of the marketing methods of real estate developers.
He believes that the confidence of developing enterprises is more important than that of buyers. The introduction of the "price guarantee agreement" is also to boost their confidence.

As for whether the buyers can be retained, he said that it depends on the influence of multiple factors such as the adjustment of policies and the loan threshold. At present, it is still necessary to wait and see.
Several data declines, Taiwan's economy starts the year poorly - chinanews.com

Xinhua News Agency, Taipei, February 11 (reported by Zhao Bo and Huang Yang) The export trade volume "five consecutive months of decline", the manufacturing purchasing managers index (PMI) has contracted for seven consecutive months, and the consumer price index (CPI) has seen "three-digit" again... Recently, the Taiwan authorities have successively released economic data for January 2023.
Experts believe that the Taiwan economy has not performed well at the beginning of the year, and the pressure of growth is not small.

According to the financial affairs department of the Taiwan government, the export of Taiwan region in January this year was 31.51 billion US dollars, down 21.2% year-on-year, and it was the fifth consecutive month of negative growth.
The export volume of 11 major export commodities declined compared with the same period last year.
The plastic and rubber products and optical equipment saw the biggest declines, with annual declines of 37.6% and 35.7% respectively.
The export of electronic components fell by 20.1% year-on-year, the largest decline in 11 years.
Among them, the annual decline of integrated circuits was 18.3%, the largest decline in 14 years.

Chou Mei-Na, head of the statistics department, said that this shows the impact of weak demand in the consumer electronics industry is spreading, and the electronics industry is entering a correction period.
Statistics show that in January, Taiwan's imports and exports both declined, with the surplus of exports amounting to only US$2.34 billion, the lowest level in the past three years.

The financial affairs department of the Taiwan government believes that the global terminal demand has decreased, the industry adjustment inventory has suppressed the manufacturers’ willingness to purchase materials, and the export slump is unlikely to improve in the short term. Therefore, the export recession in Taiwan in the first quarter of this year is likely to be higher than the expected.

According to the Taiwan Institute of Economic Research, the Taiwan Manufacturing Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) adjusted for seasonal factors was 40.4% in January, down 3.3 percentage points from December last year, and contracted for the seventh consecutive month.

In the economic monitoring index system, the PMI is the line of demarcation between prosperity and recession, with the index above 50% representing economic expansion and below 50% representing economic contraction.
In the five indicators of Taiwan PMI in January, new orders, production and human resources hiring were tightened, the delivery time of suppliers decreased, and inventory was tightened.

All six major industries reported a contraction in PMI, with the industries ranked by the speed of contraction as follows: power and machinery industry (35.1%), electronics and optical industry (35.2%), chemical and biotechnology and medical industry (39.2%), basic raw materials industry (42.4%), transportation industry (42.6%) and food and textile industry (45.7%).

In terms of prices, the “Main Accounting Office” of the Taiwan government announced that the year-on-year increase rate of the CPI in Taiwan in January was 3.04%, which broke through 3% again since July last year.
Among them, the price of vegetables soared by 28.25%, creating a new high in 17 months.

Cao Zhiming, a special committee member of the Accounting Office of the Executive Yuan, said that the increase in vegetable prices was indeed beyond expectations. Excluding the factors of the Spring Festival, the average CPI in January and February this year should be close to 2.71% in December last year. Inflationary pressure still exists and is still high.
Looking at the Taiwanese economy this year, according to the reports of the domestic media such as the United Daily News and Yahoo Finance, experts expressed pessimism.

Professor Wu Dazhen of the Department of Economics at National Taiwan University analyzed that the decline in exports may cause problems in the cash flow of export manufacturers, and the risk of debt default will rise.

At the same time, the reduction of orders leads to the reduction of human resource costs of manufacturers, which affects the labor market and family economy, and in turn, affects the consumption ability.

Qiu Dasheng, a researcher at the Taiwan Economic Research Institute, believes that the inflation situation in Europe and the United States has not been resolved this year, and demand continues to shrink. Therefore, he estimates that the decline in Taiwan's exports will continue into the first half of the year.
As Taiwan's economy is supported by exports, the economic growth in the whole year will be worse than that of last year due to the sluggish export.

Report: The number of overseas students returning to China for employment in 2022 hits a new high - chinanews.com
Top 10 countries for overseas students to study abroad in 2022 before returning to China to seek employment. Source: 2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report

China News Service, Beijing, February 11 (Reporter Men Rui) The 2022 China Overseas Returnees Employment Survey Report (hereinafter referred to as the Report) shows that the scale of graduating overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of overseas students seeking employment in China reached a new high. The demand of Chinese enterprises for overseas talents also showed an upward trend.

The report pointed out that since 2020, the number of overseas Chinese who seek jobs in China has increased significantly, and the number of overseas students who seek jobs in China has also increased.
Compared with 2021, the scale of graduating overseas students in 2022 increased by 8.6% year-on-year, and the number of overseas students returning to China for employment reached a new high.

From the distribution of the countries where the students studying abroad come from, the UK has the highest proportion, at 41.4%, followed by Australia (20.3%) and the United States (9%), which is consistent with the ranking in 2021.

Compared with the same period last year, the number of students from Malaysia, Japan and Singapore who will graduate in 2022 has increased significantly, with growth rates of 66.1%, 50.9% and 37.7%, respectively.
The number of international students from Canada, Germany, the United States and Australia has decreased year-on-year.
Trend of supply and demand of overseas talents in the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023. Source: "2022 China Overseas Talent Employment Survey Report"

The survey showed that among the overseas students who decided to return home, 58% thought that "life in China is more convenient", 40% decided to return home because they "more identified with the cultural environment in China", 32% thought that "there are more job opportunities in China", and 22% believed that the economic activities in China would recover faster, and they would have more job opportunities.
The data shows that the demand for overseas talents by domestic enterprises is rapidly released, and the demand for talents returning from abroad is on the rise.

In the first week after the Spring Festival in 2023, the number of positions for overseas returnees and the number of overseas returnees seeking jobs in China both showed an upward trend. The number of positions for overseas returnees on February 3 was 11% higher than that on January 28, and the number of overseas returnees seeking jobs in China increased by 27%.

From the industry perspective, in the 2022 overseas returnee priority positions, the positions from the education/training industry accounted for 27.8%, ranking first, while the positions from the professional services/consulting industry and the internet/e-commerce industry ranked second and third, accounting for 14.3% and 11.1% respectively.
The number of overseas Chinese people seeking employment in China in recent years. Source: “2022 China Overseas Chinese Employment Survey Report”

From the perspective of salary, the average recruitment salary of the priority positions of overseas returnees has risen for three consecutive years, reaching RMB 1,468.0 yuan/month in 2022, an increase of RMB 961 yuan/month from 2021, an increase of 7%.

Looking at the regions, the willingness of the overseas returnees to develop in the first-tier, second-tier and third-tier and below cities in 2022 has increased. The proportion of the overseas returnees who applied to these cities in 2022 was 31%, 15.7% and 14.3%, respectively, which was higher than that in 2021.

As for the gains of studying abroad, 52.7% of the returnees said that they were basically in line with their expectations, which was 2.8 percentage points higher than that of the previous year (49.9%).
28.2% of the overseas Chinese said that their income was higher than or much higher than expected, which was also higher than the 25.4% in 2021.
(End)

Henan Province standardizes and integrates the prices of dental implant medical services - chinanews.com
CCTV.com news: dental implants are an ideal choice for many patients with missing teeth, but the price of over 10,000 yuan per implant has deterred many patients from seeking treatment.
Since the beginning of this year, with the accelerated implementation of the collection of dental implants, various regions have also put the reduction of dental implant prices on the agenda.

From February 10, the price of the whole process of regular dental implant medical service in Henan Province is adjusted to 4300 yuan, and the whole process of regular dental implant cost is not more than 97% of the adjusted target.
implant-supported prosthesis refers to a method of repairing missing teeth by supporting and fixing the upper dental restoration on the lower structure implanted in the bone tissue.
According to the reporter, the price of a single regular transplantation is about RMB16,000-17,000 from transplantation to the final repair.
Patient He Ying: After the new policy, the doctor told me that my situation is about 8,000 yuan, less than 10,000 yuan, and I can save about half.

On the basis of the existing projects, Henan Province has also integrated and determined 15 medical service price items of oral implantation, such as “implantation fee (single piece)”, and unified the price and medical insurance payment categories of provincial public medical institutions. The price of 20 medical service items, such as dental implantation, have been cancelled or adjusted.

Li Yunjie, Director of the Medical Insurance and Drug and Medical Price and Tender Procurement Department of Zhengzhou Medical Security Bureau: The beneficiaries are mainly four parties. One is medical insurance, which has reduced its expenditure; the pressure on hospitals has been reduced, and patients will increase appropriately; the suppliers have obtained a market; and for our patients, they are the party that benefits the most. The cost of planting a tooth may be reduced by half or even more.

support the basic telecommunications enterprises to increase the optimization of 5G networks in key areas and venues, and add 10,000 5G base stations in the whole year. build a city-level high-quality wireless local area network.

formulate the service standards of public place wireless local area network (WLAN), promote the upgrading of WLAN in the areas with high population density and concentrated information consumption demand in all districts, and provide gigabit access capability.

build a unified authentication and supervision platform for the whole city public wireless local area network based on "deep i network", realize "one-time authentication, seamless roaming, and intelligent switching", and support the operation subject to include the social self-built AP (wireless access point) with public service capability in the authentication and supervision platform.

The plan clearly states that we should collaborate to build the Internet of Things.

explore the construction and management model of urban perception terminal based on the open source HONGMENG operating system, reduce the cost of integration, accelerate the construction of urban level Internet of Things perception platform, and promote the interconnection and intercommunication of urban area Internet of Things platform, professional Internet of Things platform in each field and network and data.

Deepen the application of the Internet of Things in urban management, public services, public security, traffic travel, and other fields, and expand the fixed perception and intelligent connected vehicles as the mobile perception collection channels of urban roads, buildings, public facilities, and other fixed perceptions.

By the end of 2023, the number of water, electricity, gas and material Internet of Things perception terminals will exceed 9 million, and 20 multi-functional smart pole application demonstration projects will be built.

The plan also mentions strengthening the integration of satellite and ground communications, deploying the construction of low-altitude network infrastructure, and promoting the deep coverage of 5G networks at sea.
At the same time, we will promote the deep coverage of 5G network at sea, build an ecosystem for industrial innovation and development, and support the hosting of top-level competitions and events.

China’s e-commerce industry is experiencing a “new variable”. How can it achieve “content is king”?
-ChinaNews.com
China News Service, February 11th, 2019, Theme: China’s e-commerce industry is surging with “new variables”. How to make “content is king”?
Xinmin Business and Finance Reporter Xia Bin
“We entered the e-commerce industry late, but we realized from the very beginning that in order to stand out from the millions of stores, content is very important.
Fangfang, a 90s girl from Guangdong, now runs a tonic food store on Douyin e-commerce, which has made a 30-year-old offline store blossom online.
With the imitation of the old Hong Kong film color and the classic Cantonese song, when you open the @Fangfang's one-meal account on TikTok, the exquisite video will make you feel refreshed.

At the recent Douyin e-commerce "Find Fellow Travelers and Share High-Quality Content" event, Fangfang, as a representative of high-quality creators, spoke at the event and introduced her experiences and insights in daily creation.

She said at the scene, "The carefully edited video has attracted a lot of attention from netizens. Many people are interested in the ingredients in my family and want to make delicious food with me. The sales have opened up.

Fangfang used the video of cooking soup to make more people love the "Guangzhou flavor". In a live broadcast, the most sold out 300,000 pieces of tonic ingredients saved the family's old shop on the verge of bankruptcy.
“No content, no e-commerce”, as short videos and live e-commerce continue to develop, people’s requirements and standards for e-commerce content are entering a new stage.
In the early stage of live streaming shopping, live streaming rooms often attract users with low-price discounts. Price advantage seems to be the only selling point at that time.

In recent years, there have been both phenomenon-level big V bloggers such as Liu Genghong and Dongfang Zhenxuan, as well as many unknown talents and merchants who have emerged in niche fields. They have improved their long-term operating benefits by continuously creating high-quality content that is in line with their brand’s personality.

Gao Yaxuan, the manager of the operation of the TikTok e-commerce star authors, said that in the past year, 6.27 million creators have turned their content into real money through TikTok e-commerce, and their content creation volume has increased by 252%, and the total transaction volume has doubled.
“Behind these numbers, we can feel the vigorous growth and vitality of the author community.
said Gao Yaxuan.

Beijing Normal University’s Communication Innovation and Future Media Experimental Platform has previously released the “E-Commerce Industry Content Ecosystem Health Index (ECHI) Report”, which analyzes the importance of “new variables” in the current e-commerce industry, namely high-quality content, from the perspective of data dimension, and uses the index to assess the content ecosystem of 27 mainstream e-commerce platforms in China.
According to the ranking of the e-commerce industry content ecological health index in the above report, Douyin e-commerce, Kuaishou, Taobao, Pinduoduo, and JD.com ranked the top five.

The report believes that the content ecosystem of e-commerce is a comprehensive concept, which integrates e-commerce and content, but not all content can be integrated with e-commerce. Only good PGC (professional-generated content) and UGC (user-generated content) can be integrated with e-commerce. The higher the value of content platform, the richer the consumption and promotion scenarios, the higher the possibility of e-commerce implantation, and the stronger the commercial value. The proportion of e-commerce content production and

At the scene, Yu Guoming, a professor of Beijing Normal University School of Journalism and Communication and the chairman of the China Media Economics and Management Professional Committee, analyzed and interpreted the report.

He said that in terms of content value, the e-commerce industry has already transitioned from the "accessibility of consumption" to the "quality of consumption" stage, and high-quality, professional, and differentiated content is the "hard currency" of the e-commerce industry.

At the same time, content has become the fundamental and driving force of e-commerce development in the new stage, and knowledge payment, professional knowledge, KOL (key opinion leader) and other PGC content have begun to become standard in e-commerce live broadcasts.
Looking to the future development of the e-commerce industry, Yu Guoming put forward two suggestions.

One is to promote the overall improvement of the quality of e-commerce content ecology and the health of the content ecosystem from the perspective of improving the content structure, and to create positive standards for content creation and management, and to realize the index of the e-commerce industry content ecosystem health and dynamic balance.
Another is to achieve the healthy development of the content e-commerce industry and the value co-creation and co-creation of the external environment from the perspective of external ecology.

“In the future, the e-commerce industry will need more data and AI support to form a prediction of stability for future development; in addition, it will provide a more standardized and healthy growth space for merchants, and realize the value co-creation of enterprises, users, products and services in the e-commerce industry, and jointly create a healthy content ecosystem.
”(End)
Beijing Stock Exchange to launch margin trading next week - chinanews.com

(Reporter Sun Jie) Last night, the Beijing Stock Exchange announced that, after approval from the China Securities Regulatory Commission, the margin trading business of the Beijing Stock Exchange will officially start on February 13. At that time, the securities companies that have obtained the margin trading rights of the Beijing Stock Exchange can accept the delegation of investors and apply for margin trading to the Beijing Stock Exchange.
The list of the first batch of 56 stocks for margin trading was determined with January 31, 2023 as the calculation base date.

The North Exchange said that the list of stocks for margin trading and the list of securities that can be used as collateral will be published in the "Information Disclosure - Margin Trading Information" section of the North Exchange official website, which will be convenient for investors to inquire.
Margin trading is an important basic system in the securities market, and is also a relatively mature trading method in the international securities market.
On September 2 last year, the North Exchange announced the establishment of the one-year anniversary and publicly solicited opinions on the margin trading business.

The launch of the margin trading of the North Exchange is an important measure to continuously promote the construction of the North Exchange market system, improve the trading mechanism, and enhance the pricing function of the secondary market.

The margin trading system is beneficial to enriching the investment strategies of investors, satisfying the diversified trading needs of investors, promoting the discovery of market prices, and further improving the liquidity of the market.

Next, the North Exchange will continue to do a good job in all aspects of the guarantee work of financing and margin trading under the leadership of the China Securities Regulatory Commission, and will enrich the trading system tools with the needs of investors as the guide, improve the relevant supporting mechanisms, and focus on building a first-class exchange to serve innovative small and medium-sized enterprises.

(DSWW) The Biden administration will put six Chinese entities on the blacklist on Friday, February 10, for their alleged involvement in the balloon espionage program.

The US Department of Commerce said that these five Chinese companies and one research institute helped the Chinese military to modernize, especially in aviation and aerospace projects, including airships and aircraft.
Companies on the blacklist will find it difficult to obtain US technology exports.

The list is called the "entity list", and companies on the list will not be able to purchase technology or goods from US suppliers unless they obtain a special export license from the US Department of Commerce.

The companies on the blacklist are: Beijing Nanjiang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., the 48th Research Institute of China Electronics Technology Group, Dongguan Lingkong Remote Sensing Technology Co., Ltd., the Eagle Gate Aerospace Technology Group Co., Ltd., Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aerospace Technology Co., Ltd., and Shanxi Eagle Gate Aerospace Technology Group Co., Ltd.
Before that, the White House said it was considering broader measures to "expose and address" China's larger-scale surveillance activities that threaten U.S. national security.
The balloon incident has caused further tension between China and the United States, and US Secretary of State Blinken has canceled his visit to China.

On February 4, the United States shot down the balloon. The Chinese government lodged a solemn protest with the US embassy in China, criticizing the United States for seriously undermining and damaging the efforts and progress of both sides to maintain stable China-US relations.

From the existing wreckage evidence and the information of the procurement platform of the Chinese military, the US government has concluded that the manufacturer of the balloon is "directly related to the Chinese People's Liberation Army" and is a supplier approved by the Chinese military.

Mao Ning, spokesperson of the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs, said at a press conference on Friday that China has explained the situation and clarified its position on the incident of a Chinese civilian balloon entering the US airspace due to uncontrollable factors.
According to the website of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, she added that the relevant resolution of the US Congress was purely a political manipulation and hype.
China strongly objects to and firmly opposes this.

Matthew Axelrod, the assistant secretary of commerce in charge of export enforcement, said, "Today's action shows that we are working together to identify and stop China's use of spy balloons that violate the airspace of the United States and more than 40 countries.
A staff member of Guangzhou Tianhai Xiang Aviation Technology Co., Ltd. said that he was not aware of the sanctions and refused to make further comments, according to a Reuters report.
The Chinese embassy in the United States and the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs have not yet commented on these information.
(Reuters, etc.)
