(DW.com) Several days after the earthquake hit parts of Turkey and Syria, the hope of finding survivors is fading. But on Saturday, a family of five was rescued, bringing relief to the search and rescue teams.

According to the report of the Associated Press, this five-member family was rescued successfully after being trapped under the debris for more than five days in the town of Nurda, which is a severely affected area in Gaziantep province.
The rescuers first pulled out the mother and daughter from the debris, and then found the father. However, he insisted on saving his son and another daughter first.
After all of them were rescued, cheers erupted from the crowd.
In the southern Turkish city of Kahramanmaras, a 16-year-old boy and a 70-year-old woman were also rescued in the harsh cold weather.
what day is it today?
“- After being rescued from the rubble, the 129-hour trapped boy asked the rescuer.
A man from Kahramanmaraş holds his cat that was just rescued
The miraculous rescue cases brought a glimmer of hope to the search and rescue work that was already hopeless, but at the same time, the number of casualties was also increasing.
According to official statistics, the earthquake on Monday has caused more than 20,000 deaths in Turkey, and the death toll in neighboring Syria is estimated to be more than 3,500.
Although experts said that people can survive for more than a week after being trapped in the rubble, the hope of finding more survivors has become more and more dim.
Rescuers are still using thermal imaging to search for signs of life under the rubble.
At the same time, the focus of the rescue work began to shift to helping the survivors who were in urgent need of help.
UN official: 'Century in a day' disaster in the region

Martin Griffiths, the deputy secretary-general of the United Nations in charge of humanitarian affairs and the coordinator of emergency relief, said at a press conference in Turkey that this earthquake was the "worst disaster in the region in a century".
He also praised Turkey's post-disaster response as "unprecedented".
He also told Reuters that he hoped to provide aid to areas controlled by both the Syrian government and opposition forces, but said the details were "not clear."
The United Nations has pledged to provide an additional $25 million in aid to the earthquake-stricken areas of Syria.
Earlier this week, the United Nations announced that it would provide $25 million in aid to Turkey and Syria.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great Chilean Earthquake (1960)
At 3:11 pm on May 22, 1960, the largest earthquake ever recorded by humans occurred in Valdivia, Chile, with a magnitude of 9.5.
In just ten minutes, the whole city of Valdivia was reduced to rubble.
The huge tsunami triggered by the earthquake hit the coastline of Chile, with waves as high as 25 meters.
The tsunami reached as far as Japan and the Philippines.
The number of casualties and economic losses caused by such a disaster cannot be accurately known.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
The Great Alaska Earthquake (1964)
March 27, 1964 was a Friday and Good Friday.
On this day, the largest earthquake in the history of North America occurred in Alaska, USA, with a moment magnitude of 9.2.
The 2006 Alaska earthquake was the third largest earthquake ever recorded.
The quake occurred when a fault between the Pacific and North American plates ruptured near the College Narrows in Prince William Sound.
The earthquake lasted for 3 to 5 minutes in most areas.
The seabed displacement triggered a huge tsunami with a height of 67 meters.
Because it was a holiday, many schools and enterprises were closed.
The earthquake finally caused 139 deaths.
Nine people died directly in the earthquake, and the other 130 people died in the tsunami triggered by the earthquake.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Tangshan earthquake (1976)
On July 28, 1976, two strong earthquakes with a magnitude of 7 or more occurred in Tangshan City and Fengnan County, Hebei Province within 16 hours.
The epicenter was 23 kilometers from the ground.
The whole city of Tangshan was destroyed in an instant, with all transportation, communication, water supply and power supply interrupted.
The capital Beijing, 140 kilometers away, also felt strong tremors.
According to official statistics, a total of 242,769 people died and 164,851 people were seriously injured in all the disaster-stricken areas, including Beijing and Tianjin.
The Tangshan earthquake became the second deadliest earthquake in China's recorded history, second only to the Jiajing earthquake in 1556.
But scientists overseas estimate that this earthquake may have caused at least 650,000 deaths.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Great earthquake in the Indian Ocean (2004)
On December 26, 2004, an earthquake occurred 160 kilometers west of Aceh province on the island of Sumatra, Indonesia. The epicenter was 30 kilometers deep, and the magnitude was 9.1 to 9.3.
The earthquake triggered a huge tsunami with waves as high as 15 to 30 meters.

A total of 14 countries along the Pacific coast were affected by the disaster, and the most severely affected areas include Aceh province in Indonesia, the Koh Lanta and Phuket holiday resorts in Thailand, Sri Lanka and the Tamil Nadu state in India.

At that time, it was the peak season for tourism during Christmas. The disaster area was crowded with tourists and local residents, which caused many tourists enjoying their holiday on the beach and local people working by the sea to be swept away by the tsunami and buried under the sea, which made many people missing in this earthquake.
It is estimated that at least 300,000 people died or went missing.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Wenchuan earthquake (2008)
On May 12, 2008, a major earthquake occurred in Wenchuan, Sichuan Province, China.

According to the data of the China Earthquake Administration, the surface wave magnitude of this earthquake is 8.2 and the moment magnitude is 8.3. The area of destruction is more than 100,000 square kilometers.

As of September 25, 2008, the earthquake had caused 69,227 deaths, 17,923 missing, 374,643 injuries of different degrees, 19.93 million people lost their homes, and a total of 46.256 million people were affected.
It is the most destructive earthquake since the founding of the People's Republic of China, and also the most serious casualties since the Tangshan earthquake.

In March 2009, the State Council of China announced that May 12th of every year would be designated as Disaster Prevention and Reduction Day to strengthen the education of the public and the attention to disaster prevention and reduction work.
Afterwards, governments and primary and middle schools in many parts of China hold earthquake drills on this day every year.
Primary and secondary schools also began to pay attention to the popularization of "earthquake prevention and disaster reduction" education.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Haiti earthquake (2010)
On January 12, 2010, a 7.0 magnitude earthquake hit the Caribbean island nation of Haiti.
The epicenter of the earthquake is located 25 kilometers south of the capital of Haiti, Port-au-Prince, and the epicenter is about 13 kilometers deep.
The International Red Cross estimates that about 3 million people have been affected by the earthquake.
The confirmed death toll released by the Haitian government is more than 200,000.
In some parts of Haiti, as much as 90% of the houses were destroyed by the earthquake.
Although the international community provided a lot of aid and support, this poor country with overpopulation and corruption has never recovered from the disaster.
The most destructive earthquakes in the world in the past 60 years
Japan's Tohoku earthquake (2011)
On March 11, 2011, a large reverse fault earthquake with a magnitude of 9.0 occurred in the offshore area of northeastern Japan.

The epicenter of the earthquake is located in the Pacific Ocean east of Sendai, the capital of Miyagi Prefecture, and the depth of the earthquake is measured at 24 kilometers. It triggered a huge tsunami with a maximum wave height of 40.1 meters.
This earthquake is the first earthquake with a magnitude of more than 9 that has been recorded in Japan.
About 22,000 people died in the disaster, and about 400,000 buildings were completely destroyed or collapsed.
The Fukushima No. 1 nuclear power plant was affected by the earthquake and tsunami and suffered a leakage accident.
This accident was classified as the most serious level 7 on the International Nuclear Event Scale (INES).
The Fukushima nuclear accident caused the detection of minute radioactive substances in the world, including iodine-131 and cesium-137 (half-life of 30 years).
A large amount of radioactive isotopes were released into the Pacific Ocean as a result of this nuclear accident.
According to the statistics of the United Nations, at least 870,000 people in the disaster areas of Syria and Turkey urgently need food.
In Syria alone, as many as 5.3 million people have been displaced by the earthquake.
The World Food Programme (WFP) has called for $77 million to provide food for the displaced people in Turkey and Syria who have been affected by the earthquake.
The temperature in the disaster area is as low as minus 10 degrees Celsius, and many victims have no shelter.
The Turkish government has distributed a lot of hot meals, tents and blankets, but these supplies are still difficult to reach many people in need.
In Syria, which has been mired in a civil war for 12 years, the earthquake has made the people's difficult situation worse.
In the four days since the earthquake, the World Food Programme has already provided food assistance to 115,000 people in Turkey and Syria.
The World Health Organization (WHO) sent 72 tons of medical supplies for treating injuries and emergency surgeries.
(Associated Press, Reuters, etc.)

NEWS GOV-MO: Police Bulletin: Police urge citizens to be on guard against fake mobile phone company fraud messages

Recently, the Police and Customs Services Bureau received multiple cases of telecommunications fraud. Criminals have been pretending to be local telecommunications companies and sending fraudulent text messages to victims with links to websites. They use the bait of accumulated points expiring and needing to be exchanged for rewards to trick victims into logging into fake websites to exchange.

The victim entered his credit card information and verification code according to the instructions, and then received a notification from the financial institution that there was an unknown consumption record on his credit card, suspecting that his credit card information was stolen by the above website.
After investigation, it was confirmed that the relevant telecommunications companies did not send the above short message.

The police urged the public to be on guard if they received similar mobile phone messages, and not to log in to the website link or provide any personal data; if they were asked to provide credit card data, account transaction passwords, or transaction verification codes, they should be even more cautious to prevent credit card theft and fraud.
Anti-fraud tips:
1. Pay more attention to the information of network security, and improve the awareness of personal prevention;
2. Do not log in to unknown websites and register personal and credit card information on the website to prevent theft;
3. Beware of fake websites and phishing websites, and always check whether the website address is completely consistent with the official website;
4. Install anti-virus software on your mobile phone, mobile device, or computer, and update it regularly;
5. If you suspect that you have been defrauded or involved in other crimes, please call the Anti-Fraud Inquiry Hotline 8800 7777 or the Police Emergency Hotline 993 for assistance.

In his reply, Xi Jinping said that you have overcome difficulties in work and life in Central Africa and served the local people with your heart. You are not only white-clad angels who save lives and injuries, but also friendly envoys who convey friendship.

In 1963, China sent its first medical team to Algeria.

Google AI chatbot "answers wrong questions", mother company's stock price evaporates $10 billion
(Combined news on the 11th)

Google's new AI chatbot Bard failed to make a good start, as it "answered the wrong questions" in a promotional video, causing the share price of its parent company Alphabet to fall by 8.9% on Thursday, breaking through the $100 mark, and the market value of the company evaporated by $110 billion (RM47.65 billion), closing at $94.57 on Friday.
The market is concerned that Alphabet is not as competitive as Microsoft.

According to the report of Reuters, Google released a promotional video of its AI chatbot Bard on social media earlier. In the video, someone asked Bard: "What new discoveries about the James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) can I tell my 9-year-old child?
"Bard mentioned in his reply that the telescope had taken the first picture of exoplanets in the solar system.

However, according to the data of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration, the first photo of exoplanets was taken by the "Very Large Telescope" of the European Southern Observatory in 2004.
Reuters reported the news with the headline "Alphabet's stock price plunges after Bard's wrong answer".

On the other hand, Google pointed out that Bard's response "highlights the importance of rigorous testing process", which will combine external feedback with its own internal testing to ensure that Bard's response "meets high standards in terms of quality, safety and real information".
Singapore’s tourism industry rebounds strongly, with inbound tourists up 19 times from 2021

(Singapore News Agency, November 11) The Singapore Tourism Board recently announced that it is expected that the number of international visitors to Singapore in 2023 will reach 12 million to 14 million, which will bring about tourism revenue of about S$18 billion to S$21 billion; the number of visitors and tourism revenue will recover to about 67% to 75% of the level before the COVID-19 pandemic in 2019; and it is very likely that the tourism
Singapore's tourism market is gradually restarting and recovering in 2022.

The latest statistics released by the Singapore Tourism Board show that the number of inbound tourists increased by 19 times from 330,600 in 2021 to 6.3 million in 2022, surpassing the Tourism Board's earlier estimate of 4-6 million, and the number of tourists has recovered to 33% of the pre-epidemic level.

From January to September 2022, Singapore’s tourism revenue totaled 8.96 billion Singapore dollars, and it is expected that the tourism revenue in 2022 will reach 13.8 billion to 14.3 billion Singapore dollars, which is 6 to 7 times the 1.89 billion Singapore dollars in 2021, and has recovered to about 50% to 52% of the level before the COVID-19 epidemic in 2019.<|im
The Singapore government has taken multiple measures to accelerate the recovery of the tourism industry.
In April 2022, the government announced that it would allocate nearly S$500 million to stimulate the recovery of the tourism industry.

The Ministry of Tourism recently announced that it plans to allocate S$110 million from this budget over the next two years to launch more commercial and leisure activities to attract tourists to return.

In order to make health and longevity a tourist attraction in Singapore, the Singapore Tourism Board launched an intention collection activity on November 23, 2022, planning to develop a health and longevity attraction on the southern coast of Singapore.

Wang Lingli, the director of the Executive Office of Sports and Health Tourism of Singapore Tourism Board, said that in recent years, more and more tourists have put their physical health as the top consideration factor.

Developing a health and wellness destination in the southern part of the island, which is home to the Gardens by the Bay and the Marina Bay Waterfront, will help boost Singapore's tourism and economy, and encourage tourists to spend more and stay longer in Singapore.
Chen Jianlong, Director of Singapore Tourism Board, said that in the next few years, health and longevity will become an important part of Singapore’s tourism products.
The COVID-19 pandemic has raised the public's awareness and demand for physical and mental health.
For this reason, the Tourism Bureau has been promoting health and longevity projects to the local public and international tourists for the past two years.
In June 2022, the Singapore Tourism Board held the first Health and Wellness Festival, offering more than 130 different health activities and experiences to the public.
Singapore will continue to provide new travel experiences for tourists.

In addition to the new Avadon World in the Gardens by the Bay, the Central Beach Promenade Market in Sentosa, the new “Explore New Frontiers” gallery at the Art Science Museum, and the open-air theater at the Night Safari, the Ministry of Tourism will support the development and renewal of projects such as the Bird Park at the Wild Wild World to make Singapore an attractive international tourist destination.

According to the plan, Singapore will formulate the industry standards for the sustainable development of the meeting, exhibition and incentive tourism industry by the end of 2023, and focus on improving the problems of waste disposal and carbon emissions, further optimizing the tourism environment.
Singapore's tourism industry is recovering faster, which is accelerating the recovery of the aviation industry.

Data shows that as of December 18, 2022, the passenger flow at Changi Airport has recovered strongly, with the number of passengers reaching 150,000 per day and 1 million per week, which is equivalent to 75% of the pre-pandemic level. The number of aviation employees on duty has also recovered to about 90% of the pre-pandemic level.

Data shows that Singapore has received 23.6 million tourists from January to October 2022, which is equivalent to 42% of the pre-pandemic level. The number of take-off and landing flights is 170,000, which is 53% of the pre-pandemic level.
The rapid recovery of the tourism industry has also driven the recovery of the hospitality, transportation, catering and retail industries.
The Singapore government and tourism industry have high expectations for the Chinese market.

Koh Shu Dan, the assistant director of the International Department of Singapore Tourism Board, said that a survey conducted by a Chinese travel platform showed that Singapore ranked third in the world in terms of safety index, which is also one of the reasons why Singapore is so popular among Chinese tourists.
Before the COVID-19 pandemic, about 3.6 million Chinese people traveled to Singapore for vacation every year.
With the relaxation of China's border policy, it is expected that the number of Chinese tourists will recover to 30% to 60% of that in 2019 this year.
Ko Shu-tan pointed out that the Tourism Bureau will closely monitor the signals of China’s further relaxation of outbound travel policies to cope with the changes in tourist demand.

In addition to strengthening partnership with online travel platforms and tour agencies in China such as Ctrip, the Singapore Tourism Board will also actively prepare to welcome Chinese tourists in response to the new trends of outbound tourism in China.

Looking ahead to the tourism market in 2023, the Singapore Tourism Board is confident that as long as the global economy does not experience a significant recession that affects public income, and there are no new large-scale deadly outbreaks of COVID-19, the tourism industry will recover faster than expected.
Kim Jong-un and his daughter interacted closely, while his wife was left out

(Combined news on the 11th) North Korea held a military parade on the evening of August 8 to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the founding of the military. Kim Jong-un's daughter Kim Ju-ae not only attended the event, but also stood on the podium with her father.

On the 9th, North Korean state media released a film showing Kim Jong-un’s father Kim Jong-il and his daughter Kim Yo-jong. In the film, Kim Yo-jong is seen leaning on her father’s side, looking at him affectionately and whispering to him. She is also seen gently holding her father’s face and even touching his chest. The film was broadcasted nationwide.
However, First Lady Ri Sol-ju could only retreat to the side.

According to the reports of Korean "Chosun Shinbo" and other media, Kim Jong-un and Ri Sol-ju attended the banquet on the 7th with their daughter Kim Ju-ai. In the official photo of the banquet, Kim Ju-ai sat in the middle of her parents, which was rare. On the evening of the next day, the 75th anniversary of the military parade, she also stood on the podium with Kim Jong-un.

After the event, the North Korean official media, the Central Television of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, released the film of the military parade, which exposed more scenes of deep father-daughter affection.

Kim Jong-un looked at his daughter several times from the podium, and the smiles on their faces never faded. They also whispered to each other, and Kim Jong-loi once held his father's cheeks with both hands. Kim Jong-un responded with a smile.

Other official media images also show that the benefactor loves Kim Jong-un, who is sitting on a sofa in the room, and keeps touching his father’s face; she holds her father’s hand and walks with him, and touches Kim Jong-un’s chest.
The first lady, Ri Sol-ju, could only walk behind or sit beside her husband and daughter, and was always a few steps behind.

The Korean media pointed out that Kim Jong-un has appeared in public more and more frequently since he made his first public appearance after the test launch of the Hwasong-17 missile on November 18 last year. This is the fifth time he has appeared in an official setting.

The North Korean official media used the highest honorifics such as the most beloved son and the noble son when mentioning Kim Jong-un, and also broadcasted the footage of Kim Jong-un repeatedly shouting that he would die for the white bloodline while looking down on the military parade from the stand.

These signs have led the outside world to suspect that Kim Jong Un has already been designated as the successor to the Kim regime. The Washington Post analysis believes that "this is a signal that Kim Jong Un is pushing his daughter to the position of successor". However, some people believe that such a judgment is still too early, and that there are still various possibilities in the case that Kim Jong Un has a son.

Q: How does Chongyong Investment view the US non-farm employment data in January that exceeded expectations and its future trend?

A:On February 3, the US Department of Labor released the non-farm employment data for January 2023. The number of new non-farm jobs increased by 517,000, which was significantly higher than the market expectation of 189,000; the unemployment rate fell to 3.4%, which was the lowest in nearly 50 years; the year-on-year growth rate of hourly wages was 4.4%, and the month-on-month growth rate was 0.

From the total amount, this data is affected by many one-off and technical factors, such as the return to work of teachers and workers after the strike, the revision of the survey and statistical methods, and the update of the seasonal factors. It is likely to be revised in the future (for example, the number of new non-agricultural jobs in January 2022 was revised down from 504,000 to 364,000). The non-agricultural employment may not be as strong

From the structural perspective, the impact of layoffs in high-tech enterprises still exists, but the proportion is low; the new employment in high-contact service industries such as leisure hotels and education and health care has risen sharply, and the data shows that the labor force gap in the service industry still exists.

The rebound of the service industry PMI, job vacancies and labor shortage data that exceeded expectations, as well as the strong consumption credit data, we judge that the US service industry has experienced rapid recovery after extreme weather and holidays.
We believe that the tight supply and demand in the US labor market cannot be improved without a recession.

Currently, the US labor market has a supply gap of more than 5 million, while the labor participation rate is rising slowly, especially the labor participation rate of 25-54 years old has approached the peak before the epidemic.
In addition, due to the strong excess savings and consumption credit of American residents, the strong consumption demand will further delay the impact of tightening policy on the employment market.
The tight supply and demand in the US labor market will be the background of the US economy in 2023.
With the interest rate hike nearing its end, inflation expectations are constantly fluctuating, and we are not optimistic about the continuous decline in wage growth.
Before the release of this data, the US stock, bond and foreign exchange markets were overly optimistic about the Fed’s interest rate hike path.

As inflation data continues to improve, the Fed is maintaining a fragile balance of market inflation expectations while shortening the pace of interest rate hikes, but the market is ignoring the Fed's hawkish rhetoric, not only expecting an early end to interest rate hikes, but also expecting two interest rate cuts by the end of the year.

In the face of tight supply and demand in the labor market and the uncertain impact of tightening policies, we believe that the Fed's guidance on interest rate hikes at the end of the year is relatively reasonable. The adjustment of extreme expectations and crowded trading may cause some damage to the market.

However, the stubborn wage growth will not change the current trend of rapid decline in inflation. With the M2 data turning negative and the leading indicators of various CPI items gradually improving, the US CPI data has turned to the stage of rapid decline since October. The stubborn wage growth will only form a bottom for the future inflation data. The current market expectation is difficult to disprove. After the next inflation data is released, the market may enter a new round of bargaining.

“Fund E Account” is here: CSRC authorizes development, and all funds under investors’ names are consolidated and queried - Economic Observation Network - Professional Financial News Website
Economic Observation Network Reporter Chen Shang: The complicated channels of fund purchase make it difficult to collect account information?
Always forgetting the "small savings box"?
These problems of the fund investors will be solved soon.

On February 10, the China Securities Regulatory Commission announced that the "Fund E Account" APP was available for download in various mobile application stores and was open for public trial operation.

According to the introduction, the "fund E account" provides a "one-stop" inquiry service for the account and share information of public funds for individual investors, which aims to solve the industry service pain points such as forgetting the account and complicated inquiry for a large number of small and medium-sized investors.

According to Wind data, as of the end of 2022, there were a total of 156 domestic public fund managers, with a total fund scale of about RMB2.6 trillion; there were 167 public fund share registration institutions and 411 public fund sales institutions.
Each quota registration institution account system is independent of each other, and lacks a unified query channel in the industry.
Industry insiders said that by the end of 2021, the number of fund investors in China exceeded 720 million, which means that half of the population invested in fund products.

Previously, investors had to inquire about the purchase situation through different sales institutions, but with the "fund E account", they can inquire about the purchase situation in all sales channels, and the holding situation of the fund is clear at a glance.
What is the "Fund E Account" APP?

According to relevant documents, the "Fund E Account" APP is a public fund industry mobile application developed and built by the China Settlement Corporation after approval by the China Securities Regulatory Commission. It can provide investors with a one-stop inquiry of the off-exchange holdings of public fund products.

Investors can conveniently and quickly grasp the situation of holding the off-market shares of the public fund products of the fund managers under their management through the "fund E account" and comprehensively improve the query efficiency.

Specifically, the information that investors can inquire through the "fund E account" includes: the fund account information opened at the fund management people of the whole city, the transaction account information opened at the sales institutions of the public fund, and the off-exchange holding status of the products such as the collective asset management plan that is not limited by 200 investors, including the public fund securities investment fund and the securities company.

Liu Yiqian, head of the Shanghai Securities Fund Evaluation Research Center, told the reporter of the Economic Observer that investors can get all the information of their public fund holdings through the "Fund E Account" App, which helps them to find their "forgotten assets". More importantly, it helps customers to collect all the information of their fund investment, so that they can better optimize their fund portfolio and better plan their financial arrangements.
How to register and use?

The reporter noticed that the "Fund E Account" APP has been available in Huawei, Apple, Xiaomi, Oppo, vivo and other mobile application stores, but the APP is still in the public trial operation stage, and registration requires filling in the invitation code, and investors can contact the fund manager of the fund they hold to obtain it.

A customer service staff of a large public fund in Shanghai provided a six-digit invitation code to the reporter of the Economic Observer Network and told the reporter, "During the trial operation stage, the China Settlement provides a certain number of invitation codes to each fund manager. Investors can get them by calling. We will provide them to you.
After the trial run, when opening user registration, there will be no invitation code.

The reporter registered the account and completed the inquiry by downloading and using the relevant documents of the "fund E account" published on the official website of the China Securities Regulatory Commission. The whole process took only a few minutes, and it was mainly divided into four steps: user registration, real-name authentication, fund account binding, and public offering fund inquiry.

After the real-name authentication, click the "asset" fund binding button, and all the fund products purchased by the reporter through various fund sales platforms will be presented in the binding option list (can be bound account), after binding, the total assets of the invested fund can be seen directly and the query function can be started.
It is worth noting that the "fund E account" only provides query service for investors and cannot perform redemption and purchase.
The data date shown by the "Fund E Account" is generally the date three trading days before the date on which the user makes the inquiry (T day).

For example, when the "fund E account" was opened on February 10, the total assets, fund shares, and fund net value shown on the asset page corresponded to the date three trading days before, i.e. February 7.

Lawyers' Union Mobilizes Another Anti-Retirement Reform Scheme March

This is the fourth time in a month that the eight major trade unions in France have jointly launched a nationwide mobilization, and this is the first time that the protest has arranged the rally on Saturday.

Since the protest against the government's pension reform plan began, although polls show that most French people do not support the measure to postpone the legal retirement age from the current 62 to 64, the number of people who actually take to the streets to participate in the march has been gradually decreasing.

Last East German communist prime minister dies
Hans Modrow, the successor to the East German Communist Party, died at the age of 95, the party said in a statement.
Therefore, our party has lost an important leader.
On Nov. 13, 1989, four days after the Berlin Wall, which had separated East and West Berlin for 28 years, was opened, Modrow said he would help turn East Germany into a democracy.
At the time, the communist leaders were forced to resign as protesters across East Germany demanded democracy and freedom.
After coming to power in the Soviet Union, Gorbachev also demanded changes in the Soviet-dominated Eastern Europe.
In March 1990, Modrow announced the first and only free elections in the GDR.
The election results led to his resignation as prime minister.
Despite the reforms, critics accuse him of trying to delay the political changes and reunification that took place in October 1990.
He was also criticized for trying to rebrand rather than abolish the secret police.
In 1993, Modrow was convicted of election fraud in the May 1989 municipal elections, but did not go to jail.
Some people said that these accusations were politically motivated.
From 1990 to 1994, Modrow continued to serve in the German Bundestag and from 1999 to 2004, he served as a member of the European Parliament.
Moderow sees himself as a reformer and wants to change the Communist Party from within.
In 1999, he told Reuters that he did not want the old East Germany to return, but said that the achievements of East Germany should be recognized.
Moderow was born in 1928 in the then-German town of Jasenitz (now Jasienica, Poland), and trained as a mechanic.

During World War II, he served as a platoon leader in the youth fire brigade and, as the conflict was drawing to a close, became a member of the Volkssturm, a Nazi paramilitary organization that recruited men aged 16 to 60 for the final struggle.
At the age of 17, Modro was captured by the Soviet army and taken to the Soviet Union as a prisoner of war. There he participated in anti-fascist courses and became a firm communist.
In 1949, the year the GDR was founded, he returned to his homeland and found a job as a mechanic, and continued his studies in social sciences and economics, earning a doctorate.

Moderow was a member of the Freie Deutsche Jugend, a movement that almost all young East Germans joined, and rose through the ranks of the ruling Socialist Unity Party (SED) to become chairman of the party in Dresden from 1973 to 1989.
He served in the East German parliament for more than 30 years.
In 1990, Modrow became the de facto leader of East Germany and held the highest national office.

Turkey and Syria earthquake relief efforts continue day and night

Since a powerful earthquake shook Turkey and neighboring Syria, rescue teams from dozens of countries have been working around the clock in the rubble of thousands of collapsed buildings to save survivors buried under the debris.
They often urge silence in the cold, as they strain to hear any sign of life from the rubble.
According to the report of Reuters today, two more women were rescued after surviving for several days in the debris of the earthquake.
But the death toll from the quake has risen to 24,150.
Turkey has recorded 20,665 deaths, while Syria has recorded more than 3,500.

The 7.8 magnitude earthquake that struck on Monday, followed by several strong aftershocks in Turkey and Syria, is the seventh deadliest natural disaster of the century, surpassing the 2011 earthquake and tsunami in Japan and approaching the 31,000 deaths caused by an earthquake in neighboring Iran in 2003.
A similar strong earthquake in northwestern Turkey in 1999 killed more than 17,000 people.
Two women were rescued from the rubble of collapsed buildings in Turkey on Saturday, 122 hours after being trapped in the region's deadliest earthquake in two decades, the authorities said.
Another injured man, 55, was identified as Masallah Cicek, who was rescued from the rubble of a collapsed building in the southeastern Turkish city of Diyarbakir.
In the cold, rescuers often urge silence as they strain to hear any sign of life amid the rubble.
In Samandag district in Turkey, rescuers crouched under concrete slabs and whispered "Inshallah" - "God willing" - as they gingerly reached into the rubble to pull out a 10-day-old newborn.
He opened his eyes and the baby Yagiz Ulas was wrapped in a warm blanket and carried to the field hospital.
Video images showed that the paramedics also took his mother, who was on a stretcher, dizzy and pale but conscious.

Turkish Vice President Fuat Oktay told reporters overnight that 67 people had been rescued from the rubble in the past 24 hours, and that 31,000 rescue workers had been deployed in the affected areas.
He said that about 80,000 people were being treated in hospitals, and 1.05 million people were homeless because of the earthquake, and they were crowded in temporary shelters.
As many people lack food in the cold winter, the people are increasingly questioning the two leaders' response to the disaster.
Syrian President Bashar al-Assad and his wife Asma visited a hospital in Aleppo, the first time he has visited an area affected by the earthquake, according to Syrian state media.
Earlier, the World Food Programme said it was running out of stocks in the northwest of Syria, which is controlled by rebels, because the war situation made relief work more complicated.
On Friday, Erdogan visited the Adiyaman province in Turkey, where he acknowledged that the government's response had not been as fast as expected.
Opponents have seized on the issue to attack Erdogan, who is seeking re-election in a vote on May 14 but may have to postpone it because of the disaster.
Reuters said that the anger over the delayed aid and the rescue work may affect the election.
Even before the earthquake, the vote was seen as the most serious challenge to Erdogan's 20-year rule.
Erdogan called for unity and denounced what he called a "negative campaign for political interests."

Vietnam News Agency, Hanoi - Vietnam News Agency correspondent reported that on the morning of February 11, during his visit to Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife visited the University of Brunei Darussalam (UBD, also known as the University of Brunei)
The University of Brunei Darussalam is the largest higher education and scientific research center in Brunei, and ranks third in the regional university rankings.
The University of Brunei Darussalam is one of the symbols of the cooperation between Vietnam and Brunei in education and training.
The University of Brunei Darussalam officially established a cooperative relationship with the FPT University of Vietnam in July 2013, with the main cooperation areas being English training.
In addition to English, French, moral education, Japanese and Korean, the University of Brunei Darussalam also includes Vietnamese in its teaching curriculum.
During the visit to the University of Brunei Darussalam, Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife exchanged with the students of Vietnamese language class.
Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng is delighted to see more and more foreigners like to learn Vietnamese language and make positive contributions to promoting Vietnamese culture and customs to the world.

Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng expressed his belief and hope that the Vietnamese language teaching staff of the University of Brunei Darussalam will become stronger and stronger; the students of the Vietnamese language class will become more and more interested in Vietnamese language, and make efforts to learn it, so that they can use fluent Vietnamese language as soon as possible and become envoys of the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Brunei.

During this opportunity, Premier Fan Mingzheng also communicated with Vietnamese students who were learning English at the FPT-UBD Global Center in Nha Trang via video, and learned about their learning situation, especially during the epidemic period.

Prime Minister Phan Minh Chinh said that the cooperation between Vietnam's FPT University and Brunei's University of Brunei Darussalam, especially the FPT-UBD Global Center, is a vivid symbol of Vietnam-Brunei education cooperation.

At the same time, I hope that the students of this center can make greater progress in their studies and make positive contributions to the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and Laos.

Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng highly appreciated the achievements made by the two countries in educational cooperation, including the cooperation between FPT University and the University of Brunei Darussalam, as well as the University of Brunei Darussalam’s inclusion of Vietnamese language in its teaching curriculum.

Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng hopes that the University of Brunei Darussalam will continue to pay attention to ensuring the quality of Vietnamese language teaching and further expand the scale of Vietnamese language classes.

Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh also highly evaluated the positive results of the cooperation between the two countries on the basis of the Memorandum of Understanding on Educational Cooperation signed in April 2014; and suggested that Brunei continue to provide more scholarships and effectively carry out various short-term exchange training projects, such as the Global Discovery Programme and the Discovery Year.

Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng highly appreciated the establishment of the first branch of the University of Brunei Darussalam in Vietnam in Southeast Asia; believed that the university would grow stronger in the region and the world; and further expanded the cooperation with Vietnamese universities.
At this opportunity, Premier Fan Mingzheng and his wife planted a memorial tree in the campus of Universiti Brunei Darussalam and left a message in the memorial book.

Prime Minister Fan Mingzheng wished that Universiti Brunei Darussalam would continue to make progress and contribute more and more to the education cause in Brunei Darussalam, and that it would deepen and broaden its cooperation with various educational and training institutions in Vietnam.
(End)

Vietnam News Agency, Hanoi - Vietnam News Agency correspondent reported that the official visit of Vietnamese Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh and his wife to Singapore and Brunei has been a complete success and has yielded comprehensive, practical and concrete results.
During the three-day visit to Singapore and Brunei, Premier Fan Mingzheng attended more than 30 different activities.

The achievements have injected new impetus into the development of the Vietnam-China strategic partnership and the Vietnam-Laos comprehensive partnership in a deeper, broader and more effective direction.

During the visit to the two countries, Premier Fan Mingsheng continued to reiterate the foreign policy of Vietnam's Party and state, which is independence, diversification, flexibility, willing to be a good friend and reliable partner of all countries, and a responsible member of the international community.

Strengthening relations with Singapore and Brunei is the need of each country, and it is necessary to work for the well-being of the people of each country, and for peace, stability and development in the region and the world.

At each meeting and talk, Premier Fan Mingzheng and the leaders of Singapore and Brunei agreed to continuously enhance political mutual trust through the visits of high-level delegations, effectively carrying out various bilateral cooperation mechanisms and important cooperation agreements.
Many cooperation documents were signed during this visit.

Among them, the Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economy Partnership with Singapore and the Action Plan for Strengthening the Comprehensive Partnership between Vietnam and Brunei in the 2023-2027 period are two highlights.
Vietnam and Singapore signed the Memorandum of Understanding on Green and Digital Economy Partnership.

This visit not only helps to deepen the traditional cooperation between Vietnam and Singapore and Brunei in the fields of politics, diplomacy, economy, security, defense, education and training, oil and gas, tourism, and people-to-people exchanges, but also creates a framework for cooperation in new potential fields such as digital economy, green economy, energy transition, innovation and creativity, smart city, and sustainable development.
Sultan Hassanal Bolkiah of Brunei and Premier Fan Minzheng are ready to enter the bilateral talks.

During the visit to the two countries, Premier Fan Mingsheng also took time to visit and listen to the thoughts and wishes of the Vietnamese community living in the two countries.

Both leaders agreed and supported these suggestions.

In particular, Premier Fan shared with the leaders of the two countries the aspiration for a united, peaceful, stable and prosperous ASEAN community; and agreed to maintain unity and cooperation with ASEAN countries and to enhance the central role of ASEAN in the complex and changeable regional and international situation.

With the important results, the official visit of Prime Minister Pham Minh Chinh to Singapore and Brunei has made positive contributions to effectively implementing the foreign policy of the 13th National Congress of the Communist Party of Vietnam, which prioritizes strengthening relations with neighboring countries in the ASEAN, effectively implementing the 12th conclusion of the Politburo of the Communist Party of Vietnam on the Vietnamese overseas work in the new situation (12-KL/TW), and mobilizing the whole

What is the object that was shot down in the sky over Alaska?
the situation is confusing, and there are many guesses.
On Friday afternoon (February 10), the US military used its most advanced stealth fighter jet F-22 to shoot down an unidentified object flying in the sky over Alaska.
The crash site was about 10 miles off the coast of Alaska.
This is the second time in less than a week that the US military has shot down an airborne object.
Last Saturday, a Chinese spy balloon that had been drifting in U.S. airspace for several days was shot down near the coast of South Carolina.

The second object was first detected entering U.S. airspace on Thursday night, and was tracked by the U.S. military as it moved over northeastern Alaska, flying at an altitude of 12,000 meters (40,000 feet), and was about the size of a small car, much smaller than the Chinese spy balloon that was shot down earlier.
The Pentagon also said there was no evidence that the object was maneuverable.

John Kirby, the White House National Security Council's strategic communications coordinator, said on Friday that although the specific nature of the object flying at high altitude was not clear, it "posed a reasonable threat to the safety of civilian aircraft."
Kobe said that this object was different from the spy balloon found in the United States, and it did not hang "effective load".
Kobe said, "We call it an 'object' is the best description we can make at the moment."
President Biden was "very deliberate" in making the decision to shoot down the object after consulting with the Pentagon, Koby added.

The official description of the object by the US government can be summarized as follows: the size is equivalent to a small car, there is no control stick, no hanging device, and the flight altitude is about 10,000 meters.
But these information still can't answer the basic questions, such as what this object is, which country it belongs to, and what mission it is on.
At present, many analyses and guesses on the Internet believe that this may be another Chinese balloon.
It may be like the spy balloon that invaded the US airspace and the Chinese balloon that floated over Latin America, which may have been sent to perform some tasks at different locations.
Some people also associate this object with UFOs.
The report of the US Newsweek quoted Peter Meijer, a former US congressman, who tweeted on Friday, "I really hope this 'unidentified flying object' is also a spy balloon, not a legitimate UFO".
"The irony of mixing up alien spacecraft and weather balloons is quite amusing, but it's not worth triggering an interstellar conflict," Majer said.
Majors tweeted this shortly after Kobe confirmed that the object in Alaska had been shot down.
The weekly news said that not only Majer but also other people doubted that this object was a UFO.

Republican Congressman Tim Burchett of Tennessee criticized the government's cover-up of information last month and called on the Director of National Intelligence (DNI) to release reports on "unidentified flying objects".

I don't recommend reading it
I read it a long time ago, and I just happened to see it and write a reading afterthought based on my memory.
This book is more like a collection of fragments of love in life than a collection of short stories.
The tone of this book is extremely plain, like plain water, and the words and sentences are extremely concise, and the plot is like a street in the afternoon of summer, quiet and plain.
Each short story is a snapshot of a small part of the ordinary life, without beginning or end.
Finally, they were gathered together and named "What We Talk About When We Talk About Love".

I think this collection of short stories and its title are like performance art. The author wants to express that love is not just the ups and downs on the stage, the sea and stones in urban legends, or the sweetness of you and me. Love is not represented by any of these things, nor should it be. Love is also the plain and ordinary life, the dull and repetitive days, the helplessness of life, the escape from reality, and the uncertainty of the future.<|im
As you read this book, you may recall the quarrels of the couple next door, the dull marriage of someone you know, and the unhappy love affair.

This is exactly why I don’t recommend reading it. From an aesthetic point of view, the writing and plot are both dull and uninteresting, unless your life is full of drama or you live in a candy castle, in which case you might find it interesting.

And from the perspective of thought depth, the daily scenes did not make people feel surprised or expand their thoughts and vision (this is different from Marquez’s Love in the Time of Cholera), and the short fragments did not discuss any problems, such as what kind of mistakes led to the failure of love?
what are the reasons for the breakdown of the protagonist's marriage?
So I don't recommend reading this book. It doesn't matter whether you read it or not.
The author's ideas are expressed more through techniques and genres than through plot, which is the reason why the reading experience of this book is not so good.
It is suitable for a quick read, but not for a careful reading.
The book is logical, but the content is not enough.
It explains what and why many sales theories are, but it is weak in how to do it. It only points out the direction but does not give specific measures.
Also, this book feels like it was put together haphazardly.
The examples include both domestic and foreign ones; both well-known entrepreneurs or salesmen and unknown people.
It is not clear whether the story is made up for the purpose of example, and if the author gives some examples of his own experience, it will be more convincing.
They keep changing the name of customers to clients.
The title is still the customer, but the content becomes the customer.
There are also problems such as spelling mistakes, missing punctuation marks and wrong numbering in the e-book.
In a word, this book is a good choice for those who want to learn the theory of sales, but it is not suitable for those who are already working in sales and want to improve their sales skills.
A quick guide to the internet finance

This book is very shallow, and can be said to be only an introductory course, which can help you quickly understand the whole picture of internet finance, but to understand it deeply, you still have to follow the clues and dig it yourself.

Moreover, the book was published earlier, and the content of the later WeChat payment subsidy war that cultivated user habits was not mentioned. Nowadays, the proportion of third-party payment is probably not as small as that mentioned in the book.
Nowadays, many people go out to eat with their mobile phones. Merchants also give up using UnionPay because of the high bank flow.

But I am still very grateful to the author for writing this introductory book. It is obvious that the author has at least several years of financial observation experience, and is very familiar with the financial development history of both domestic and foreign countries. Therefore, he can write such easy-to-understand contents.
It is easy to write high-sounding words, but it is difficult to write them in a way that is easy to understand.
i admire you, and i want you to know that!
The first factor to determine a person’s job satisfaction is not the salary, but whether he or she is given enough attention and appreciation in the workplace.
According to Maslow's hierarchy of needs, after the basic survival needs are met, the most urgent need is to meet the psychological needs - the need to be understood, affirmed and appreciated.
Indeed, for the Chinese, most of them are “love you but can’t say it”, even if they have love, gratitude and appreciation, they will keep it in their hearts and never say it.
The author describes five languages of appreciation: words of affirmation, quality time, acts of service, receiving gifts, and physical touch.

I think it's not so important that you know what the five languages of appreciation are, but that you can use them to appreciate and thank the people around you, whether they're your family, friends or colleagues.
In fact, the closer the relationship is, the more appreciation and gratitude is needed. Only in this way can our lives become more beautiful.
Learn to appreciate, and enterprises can retain talents to some extent and reduce the resignation rate.
Thank you for bringing us wonderful foreign thoughts and the world.
Due to the cultural background of the East and the West, there will be some differences between languages. If you have the opportunity to see the original version of the author, you will gain more.
once again, thank you to the author, translator, and editor for your hard work!

Worst shopping experience ever

On the evening of September 23, my wife's mobile phone was dropped, and I suddenly decided to order an 8P from Amazon Malaysia. There was stock, but it was not a self-operated store and there was no price increase (I was secretly happy). Since it was not a self-operated store, the shipping was slow, and the system showed that the latest receipt would be on September 27.

My wife didn't have a mobile phone, and she was very unhappy. She called me at 6:00 am the next day to ask me to think of a way to solve the problem. Later, I checked the JD.com website and found that there was a 256G model that could be delivered on the same day. I had to order another one immediately.
I just want to cancel my Amazon order.

Since the order was placed in the middle of the night, it was impossible to receive the express in the morning. At 7 o'clock, the customer called the customer service to cancel the order. The customer service replied that the order had been cancelled and asked the customer to wait for the text message notification.

Well, I just patiently waited, and when I checked my mobile phone at noon, the order was still in the status of not shipped, so I immediately contacted the customer service and asked them to cancel the order as soon as possible. The customer service replied that they had already operated OK.

At 3 pm, I checked my phone and found that the order was still there. I had no choice but to contact the customer service again to confirm that I had called three times. Please cancel the order and notify the seller not to send the goods!
The customer service contacted the seller on my request and informed me that the seller was not familiar with the system, and that he would cancel the order after he got familiar with the system.
But the seller has already known it, so please don't worry about it.
I checked the order display on Monday, and it had already been shipped. I was speechless.
Since I couldn't contact the seller directly, I had to call the customer service again.
The subsequent processing was simply ridiculous. I had to say a step, and then the customer service representative would perform the operation.
The order is still in the status of delivery refusal, and is ready to be sent again!
Will Amazon take the initiative to follow up?
The company has already received the money, so it doesn’t matter if they don’t follow up.
I'll never prepay for big items again. This is too much trouble.
